citation.article-title: Planotetraspora silvatica sp. nov. and emended description of the genus Planotetraspora.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Planotetraspora Runmao et al. 1993
The description is based on data taken from earlier studies (Runmao et al., 1993; Kudo, 2001) and our own studies.
Cells are Gram-positive, non-acid-fast and aerobic, with branching hyphae.
Long, cylindrical sporangia are formed at the ends of short sporangiophores on aerial hyphae, with each sporangium containing four spores in a single row.
Spores are short cylindrical, short rod or oval in shape (0·4–1·4×0·8–1·5 μm) and may exhibit motility.
In general, vegetative mycelia are pale yellow to white.
Cell walls contain glutamic acid, alanine and meso-A2pm.
Wall chemotype is III, according to Lechevalier & Lechevalier (1970), and the peptidoglycan type is presumed to be A1γ, according to Schleifer & Kandler (1972).
Madurose, 3-O-methylmannose, rhamnose, glucose and galactose are detected as whole-cell sugars.
Major cellular fatty acid is 10-methylated C18 : 0.
Phosphatidylethanolamine is present as the diagnostic phospholipid [phospholipid pattern type PIV, according to Lechevalier et al. (1977)].
Acyl type of cell-wall polysaccharides is acetyl.
The type species is Planotetraspora mira.
